characters: SMASH INTO THE METAL EXAMINING TABLE
JASON VOORHEES, HOCKEY MASK IN PLACE
INTENSE BRIGHT LIGHTS SNAP ON AROUND THE CLEARING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rapidly moving across the water, skimming, towards dark woods on the far shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELIZABETH MARCUS drives her Toyota Celica along this heav wooded road.  She's a young woman, innocent looking, swee and pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light is fading.  Shadows begin to overtake the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is obviously some place remote.  A sign caught briefl in her headlights says, "CRYSTAL LAKE - 4 MILES".  Elizab swings the car around a barely seen curve in the road.  S pulls up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth parks the Toyota.  She gets out, takes a look a the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A "FOR RENT" sign hangs, tacked to the porch at an angle. The place looks dark, dirty, uninviting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to her rear door, opens it and bends in to get over-night bag.  Behind her, the darkness gapes with the ominous threat of violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes back out of the car and moves to the cabin.  A porch swing, rotted and unusable, BANGS METHODICALLY agai the old wood of the house.  Elizabeth fumbles for the key and drops them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she bends down to pick off, the "FOR RENT" sign snaps chain and swings down, missing her neck by inches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startled, she rips the sign off and tosses it onto the po with a LOUD BANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth enters.  The place is damp and dank.  A layer o moldy dust has gathered.  Shadows obscure the corners of room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth put down her bag and gropes the wall for a swit She finds one.  Flips it.  The light turns on for a few b moments...then sputters and goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and goes back outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth walks slowly around the cabin, towards a decrep old woodshed at the edge of a dark, unfriendly woods.  Sh slowly opens the door...a mossy ladder rests against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth enters and walks towards the ladder.  Suddenly, woodshed door BANGS CLOSED.  Elizabeth SHRIEKS then, scrabbling at the door, flings it open and rushes outside with the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a RUSTLE off among the trees.  She hesitates aga Footsteps on dry leaves?  Just a gust of wind off the lak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a last look over her shoulder, she drags the ladder towards the cabin and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth comes back in with the ladder.  She picks up he bag, removes a four pack of bulbs and, climbing on the ladder, replaces the bulb in the living room.  The light comes on...but it's scant illumination against the dark n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, her foot slips on the slimy step of the ladder she drops the old bulb, which SHATTERS LOUDLY on the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimacing, Elizabeth climbs down the ladder and quickly sweeps up the broken glass.  Having done that, she shuts front door all the way, then puts her bag on the bed and opens it.  She takes out a few pairs of jeans and some sh and moves to the standing wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know that she will open the doors of that wardrobe and come face to face with her death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the wardrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...just a moth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her clothes away.  The sound of a branch SCRAPIN against the side of the cabin adds to the tension.  Now s turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there is no one waiting there in the doorway. Elizabeth yawns, stretches and walks up the stairwell to second floor landing, which leads into a pitch black hall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves down the hallway, then enters the bathroom and turns on the light.  Crossing to the bathtub, she bends d and turns on the hot water.  It comes spitting out, brack and brown at first, then finally clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stays, bent over the tub, letting the dirty water run down the drain.  Then she puts the plug in, filling the t for a bath.  As it fills, she undresses down to the her T-shirt and underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks over to discover that the medicine cabinet door open.  She crosses to it and closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has got to be the one.  She will close that door and there, reflected in the mirror will be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...nothing, just the dim illumination of the bathroom lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bends down to test the temperature of the tub water. It's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes her underwear and t-shirt, then puts one foot the water, testing it, then eases into the comforting war

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light in the bathroom sputters and then burns out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth SIGHS, resigned, then continues climbing into t tub when -- WHAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door blows open, banging into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth turns, startled.  She grabs her towel (brushing her makeup bag) and, wrapping the towel around her, walks slowly down the dark hallway onto the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From downstairs, she HEARS A NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bending precariously far out over the landing, she looks onto the first floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but the stirring of leaves, blowing into the cabi through the open doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a cool breeze from the doorway makes her shiver.  Slow she moves towards the stairs when we HEAR THAT SOUND AGAI from downstairs.  What the hell is it?  Once again she le far out over the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing.  Leaves.  The WHINE OF THE WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking -- something must have made that noise.  Then, suddenly, from the perfect darkness behind her, JASON VOORHEES steps out, hockey mask in place, machete sharp a ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth stands back up, OBSCURING JASON FROM VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: feeling that something is definitely not right...in fact, something is really, really wrong.  With a panicked expression, she turns around to look behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  Darkness.  Jason is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relaxing -- everything's okay.  She turns towards the sta and right into Jason, who raises his machete high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a SCREAM, she leaps backwards as Jason swings, flyin through the rotted wood of the railing and crashing down the first floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: yanking his machete from the wooden bolster on the railin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking down at her towel.  It's sliced through -- a thin line of blood crossing her stomach in a diagonal.  She ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth leaps from the porch, over an overrun flowerbed onto the hood of her car.  She quickly looks behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see Jason striding through the front door of the the cabin, coming for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she skids all the way across the hood of the car onto far side, then runs through the trees and brush in front the house -- her feet bare, her eyes panicked.  The branc seem to claw at her, tearing, scratching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: quickly gaining.  God, he moves fast!  Elizabeth turns, s us and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: turning back to face forward when -- WHACK!  She's clippe a tree and knocked to the ground.  She scrambles up and l around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth moves slowly now, turning around, her breathing quick and panicked.  Where is he?!  Is he toying with her She turns and Jason leaps in front of her, machete raised

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Elizabeth reaches into the cleavage at the fron her towel and pulls out a small pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat me, you bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fires one shot directly into Jason's forehead, knocki him back at step, then turns and bolts towards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs into this clearing then turns to see Jason rapid coming after her, striding out into the open, raising his machete ready to deliver the lethal blow when, suddenly,

dialogues.speaker: INTENSE BRIGHT LIGHTS SNAP ON AROUND THE CLEARING
dialogues.text: stunning Jason for a moment.  The girl disappears into th treeline as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cracks out from the darkness.  There are FBI AGENTS hidde behind every tree, bush and rock...and now, they are all firing on Jason at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason jerks as the bullets tear into his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there is a moment...the FBI agents watching...waitin for Jason to fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't fall.  He stands there.  His head turning slowly, searching the darkness for his next kill.  Sudden from out of the darkness we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a muffled SHOOMP! sound, then a familiar WHISTLIN a mortar shell descends on Jason in the middle of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grenade lands right at Jason's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anxious beat...then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch as Jason is blown, irrevocably, limb from limb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spinning slowly in the air in SLO-MO.  An arm, something unrecognizable, his head still in the hockey mask, then, finally

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spinning through the air to finally land, with a WET PLOP the field.  It beats once, then once more...then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of silence...then the rest of the FBI agents eme from their hiding places.  There is an eerie after-the-ba silence to the scene.  Jason's crimes have been so heinou that even in death, proximity to his mangled remains seem render a somber atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT ABERNATHY makes his way through his quiet, somehow stunned men, and over to Elizabeth.  He is clearly the ma charge -- his suit alone says that and his demeanor backs Elizabeth stands and faces him.  It is a strange tableau. bright lights, the smoke in the air, the nearly naked wom facing the man in the suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Abernathy offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good job, Agent Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his hand) Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A T.V. Camera is thrust into Abernathy's face.  The MEDIA apparently caught wind of this event.  REPORTERS scream f "Agent Abernathy...your comments..."  "What was your firs thought when..."  Abernathy smiles and puts on his best "media" face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, please... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD QUIETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It is my pleasure to announce that Jason Voorhees is finally and irrevocably...dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting some distance away on the rise of a hill.  His weathered face shows a healthy contempt for this somewhat premature celebration.  He plugs a twisty, homegrown ciga into the corner of his mouth, light a match off the beard stubble on his chin, then fires up the cigar -- a glowing coal in the darkness.  His hawk's eyes stare at something with ferocious intent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying on the ground in the clearing, not beating...but intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see the heart on a rolling metal surgical table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CORONER, a big man in his 30's, as he rolls the cart up a security checkpoint manned by TWO FBI AGENTS.  The coro hands his I.D. to FBI AGENT 1, then lifts his arms as FBI AGENT 2 pats him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two sliding doors in front of the coroner slide open he wheels the metal surgical cart inside, the door closin behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner is in the middle of his autopsy.  He talks in a microphone as he works, taking the dismembered parts of Jason from a body bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a large male caucasian...age unknown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins inspecting various organs, weighs them, takes samples.  He works methodically, making verbal notes as h works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No indication of cirrhosis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the coroner inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart is nearly twice the size of a normal heart.  Malformed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's about to lift the heart when...the heart beats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner stops.  He didn't see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to keep his composure) It appears to be filled with a black, viscous fluid...frankly, I don't know what the hell it is.  It's not blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart beats again! The coroner stares, shocked, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart undulates now as it beats...it is a hypnotic, throbbing pulse.  Something that has to be stared at. Something that awakens deep, impossible cravings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It draws the coroner towards it, his eyes glassy, transfi by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It beats faster, undulating, a gaping, kneading maw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner stares, then reaches down and takes the now furiously beating heart in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at it for a frighteningly long beat.  He brings closer to his face.  He would appear to be studying it... trying to understand what in God's name this thing is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he suddenly smiles, raises the monstrous organ t his lips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and eats the heart of Jason Voorhees!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he finishes the heart, he stands for a moment, not moving.  Then, suddenly, his throat bulges and he begins SCREAM A HORRIBLE SCREAM and, as he SCREAMS we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead silence.  Whatever is going on in that room cannot b heard through the airtight doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CORONER'S ASSISTANT walks up, carrying dinner.  The t FBI MEN stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just saw me come out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.D. please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, fumbling, the assistant takes out his I.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant walks in to see the Coroner doubled over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's the matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner straightens, then turns to the assistant.  Hi mouth is smeared with black liquid of the heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You ate already?  I was only gone ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The assistant tosses the food on the counter as the Coron takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from off the table and walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner holds the dissecting probe up to the Assistan face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Yes.  That's a probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, using his other hand, the Coroner

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up through the soft flesh under the Assistant's jaw hooki his finger through the Assistant's mouth and jerking the assistant's head down to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, the Coroner takes the dissecting probe and drives i into the back of the Assistant's skull.  The Assistant spasms...then goes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner turns and walks to the door, passing by a mir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see the reflection.  It is not the coroner walking by...it's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner/Jason strides out of the doors and walks past FBI men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's the verdict -- is Jason gonna be getting up and walking around any time soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Coroner/Jason stops and slowly turns back to the two smiling FBI men -- there will be doom here very soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight, on American Casefile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSHING SFX as the words "American Casefile" are stampe red across the screen.  Behind them, a graphic of Jason's hockey mask ZOOMS UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Voorhees -- dead...or deadly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos of the two FBI men from the morgue, dead and blood as well as photos of the dead assistant coroner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These dramatic photos were taken in the aftermath of the autopsy of Jason Voorhees, mere hours after his death at the hands of Federal Forces.  The facts:  Two security men -- dead.  A Coroner -- dead.  Another Coroner -- missing.  Are these men victims  of a serial killer only believed to be deceased?  Many say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROBERT CAMPBELL.  In his early 30's, he's got T.V. good looks.  He speaks in the overly serious "journalese" of tabloid television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Robert Campbell.  Tonight, on American Casefile, we'll talk, via satellite, to Mr. Creighton Duke -- the bounty hunter responsible for the capture of six of this country's most reviled serial killers/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to include Duke, playing idly with a small dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We recognize him as the man who we saw watching Jason die It's difficult to say how old he is -- it's his life that weathered him, not his years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Duke, how can you claim that Jason Voorhees is not truly dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times has Jason been reported killed before, Mr. Campbell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight times.  They've burned him, dipped him in nuclear waste --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But this time they bombed him and then cremated the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They coulda danced a jig on it an' fed it to goats -- don't matter.  Ya' can't kill Jason by gettin' rid of his body.  He'll come back the way he always do, to drag the kiddies into the darkness and crush their little skulls -- maybe even your skull, Mr. Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell laughs and smiles winningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's hope not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd be a big shame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look between the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the media, you've frequently been described as "salty" --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- look, just shut up.  Let's cut through the shit.  You asked me here because you want me to catch and kill Jason Voorhees for ya'.  I'll do it, but it won't be easy...and it won't be cheap.  One hundred grand, non- negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand.  However, our audience should be aware that you only charged forty thousand dollars to catch the Idaho skin stretcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skin stretcher was human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Campbell takes a moment to make sure that isn't lost on h audience.  Duke leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's get one thing straight, Mr. Campbell.  This isn't your garden variety serial killer -- there's only one way to put and end ta' put an' end to Jason Voorhees for all time and I'm the only one that knows the way.  If you want him dead truly dead -- my fee is one hundred grand. You know where to find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Duke tonight I'm prepared to offer you your sum of one hundred thousand dollars, payable only after you provide American Casefile with incontrovertible proof of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- yeah, yeah, yeah.  You just have your hundred grand ready.  For that you get the machete...the mask...the whole damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV suddenly SNAPS OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to see DIANA KIMBLE, leaning back after having just shut off. Sexy, in her early 40's, Diana is a waitress here in "Joey B's Diner".  Many people might be disturbed by the notion that Jason Voorhees is still alive, but for Diana...this means something much more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Lady Di!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana whirls around to see JOEY B. -- the frightening, no bullshit owner of the diner.  She's a big woman with a bi attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to cut into your TV time, but there's a few customers out here who'd like to eat sometime this fuckin' month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Joey B's Diner" may not be the last place in the world y want to eat, but it's at least the second to last.  A cou of hockey masks hang from the ceiling and a banner procla "JASON IS DEAD -- 2 FOR 1 BURGER SALE!" hangs on the far

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana walks out and looks at this with an amused dismay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is truly sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That comes from VICKI, the other waitress in the diner. Early 20's, she's cute and she's tough.  She moves off as Joey B. steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is not sick, Diana, this is business.  People are gonna come to see Jason's hometown and they're gonna come with appetites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHELBY, Joey B.'s husband and cook, leans out the serving window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Di -- food's up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Shelby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides him, WARD, Shelby and Joey B.'s early 20's son, sticks his head out as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma -- you seriously want me to cut these like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up a hamburger patty cut into the shape of a hoc mask -- oval with punched out eyeholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look stupid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's your dumbass fault -- they're supposed to look like hockey masks!  Now watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey B. quickly cuts a fresh hamburger patty into the appropriate shape, then balls up the cut-away meat and ho it up in front of Ward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes a whole new patty...hence the 2 for 1 burger sale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, I love this woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys make me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They break apart.  Shelby turns to Diana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Table 3, Di.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Diana as she picks up several plates and walks towards a table, passing by STEVEN FREEMAN who sits at th counter next to his friend RANDY -- a young cop in unifor Steven, early 20's and good-looking, turns to Diana -- wh he's about to say is difficult for him but he tries to ma it seem casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana -- you heard from Jessica lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets a plate down in front of him and continues walki Randy turns to Steven with a wry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allright, you're gettin' somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Diana to the table where JOSH (40's) and SHERIF LANDIS sit.  Diana gives everyone their food as Randy wal over and sits down with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josh) Burger, side of fries. (to Randy) Double burger, side of rings. (to Sheriff) Meatloaf, side of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she leans forward and plants a kiss on his lips.  Jos smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell was that on the menu? I'd have ordered a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock threat) You keep movin' in on my woman and I might have to take you out back and shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I've seen you shoot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all smile.  It's a nice moment, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (baiting him) ...I think you two should just go ahead and get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, son, I'm going' a little deaf in my old age...what did you say again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at Randy fixedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I think I'll just eat my food over by Steven and shut the hell up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josh) That's exactly what I thought he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy smiles and walks over to Steven as the Sheriff turn Diana and affectionately rubs her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything going okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legs giving you trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so bad, today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff watches Randy sit back beside Steven.  Steven glances over, catches the Sheriff's eye, then quickly tur away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven buggin' you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, he's relentless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to him, Diana.  I just need three minutes with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (warningly) Ed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (a beat) So how is Jessica?  You talked to her lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's good, considering. That kid just takes everything in stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling into food) Wonder where she got that from...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll call you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a quick kiss, then walks off. Josh watches go, then fixes the Sheriff with a knowing stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh grins.  He starts HUMMING THE WEDDING BELL MARCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How about this -- I'll make you a deal...I'll marry Diana when you quit banging Edna and concentrate on your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Poor, lonely Diana...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she arrives at another table.  The customer's face is hidden by a menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get ya'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a Voorhees burger and a side of Jason Fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man lowers the menu.  It's Duke.  He smiles.  Diana, recognizing him, takes a step back.  She recovers quickly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duke extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Creighton Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hesitantly, Diana shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of busy right now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to kill Jason Voorhees -- and I need you to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Voorhees is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he's not...and he's coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You food'll be right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you ten thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stops her.  She turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty.  Name your price.  Everyone has a price, what's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't want your money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then maybe I should offer it to your daughter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana does not, at any level, like Jessica being brought the conversation.  She leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I want.  You know why I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything about you, Diana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you really are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stops her in her tracks.  Suddenly, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N...nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just making your girlfriend there a little proposition...she's thinking it over.  Right, luv?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should be moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should mind your own business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you blow me, Chief. (a beat) After your girlfriend gets through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff thinks a second -- then, suddenly, he swings Duke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With surprising speed, Duke's hand darts up, catching the Sheriff's fist.  But, with equally surprising speed, Land brings his gun up under the man's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about my lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's your lady only cause she ain't had a taste of the Duke yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Duke, pulling him up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, Chief.  I don't think you know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are and the last thing we need around here is some freak show "bounty hunter" making trouble. I want you outta town and I want you outta town now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's very colorful, chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) Take him to my car.  I'll be out in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's comin' for you, Diana...and your daughter.  Lock your doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy takes Duke away.  The Sheriff turns to Diana, a lit proud, a little manly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry if he upset you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana angrily turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need you to fight my battle. I don't need any part-time protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saying that, she walks off.  The Sheriff glances around a the people in the diner then, a little cowed, goes outsid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she walks up to the counter where Steven sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seem to think Jason's... (in Duke's accent) ...comin' fer ya'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.  She doesn't.  Vicki walks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki moves off.  When she does, Diana turns to Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, I need to talk to you. There's something you don't know about Jessica, something you should know.  She was going to tell you herself but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana looks up and stares out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of Joey B's hockey mask spins slowly in her field of vision, but instead of looking cheesy...it now seems scary...foreboding.  Diana turns back to Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but there just may not be enough time.  If you still care about her, if you still want to try to make things better between you two...we should talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not here.  Come by my house tonight at eleven.  Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Steven looks at her worried face, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana comes out the back door of the diner, taking the garbage out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slowly moving in on her, stalking.  There shadows, the da gaps of night and woods between her and the trash...we ju know that she is going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Diana approaches it.  She flings it open with a LOUD B then dumps the trash in.  We stay close...sure she is goi into that dumpster with her trash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But no...she finishes and turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Right into Josh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Di.  I was just going to my car.  I didn't mean to frighten you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...It's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh takes the trash can from her...carries it back towar the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen...don't you worry about Ed. He'll come around.  He's too good a Sheriff to let you give him the slip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just too old for going steady, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's he and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've reached the diner.  He opens the door for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Everything'll work out.  Trust me on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Night, Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a quick hug, then closes the diner door, go back inside to clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh steps off the porch and around back to the parking l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: following him, moving in, closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDNA steps out of her car as Josh approaches.  She's an attractive woman around Josh's age.  He smiles and moves kiss her.  She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill didn't go bowling at the regular time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The League changed the damn time...but we've still got 'til ten- thirty.  Hop in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh smiles and hurries to the passenger side of the car Edna climbs back in behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly rushing towards the car, smashing into the drive door, slamming it shut with tremendous force just as Edna head is lowered to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns to Josh who stands frozen in absolute terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK, then slowly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strapped on a metal table.  Straps across his body.  Even strap to hold his head firmly in place.  FIRELIGHT dances across his apparently nude body and his terror-stricken e His terror grows as a shadow leans in to cover his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he looks down at Josh.  It is the coroner we see, but eyes are those black empty pools of Jason's evil.  Many l sores cover the man's face. Even as we watch, another seems to push its way forth fro the skin.  Clearly, they weaken the man.  He sways slight Catches his balance... and raises something into view.  A STRANGER RAZOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he begins to whimper.  The man lowers the razor toward his face.  The blade glints in the firelight as the Coroner/Jason brings it down, closer... closer... until i sharp edge touches Josh's skin.  Then, suddenly,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man begins to give Josh a shave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCRAPE of the razor is loud against Josh's unlathered moustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the cornoner/Jason moves the blade across Josh's Adam apple... carefully, expertly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the man is finished, there is a long, uncertain beat then his hands bring a hot towel into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the towel is laid over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over which we hear the STRANGLED SOUNDS of the Coroner/Ja breathing -- what the hell is he doing?  After a long mom the towel is lifted and, still in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the coroner/Jason lean in, opening his mouth wide, until his face fills the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, then Josh SCREAMS a horrible SCREAM as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a dark and evil aura to the house, but it is not Victorian haunted house of some storybook tale of ghosts. a place built as a summer home in the forties... abandone years ago... it looks now as if it is dissolving slowly b into the small, encroaching corner of the lake behind it into the woods around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the sense of evil doesn't come from the rot or the decay... those are just symptoms. The sense of evil comes from the core of darkness that we feel in every gaping window.  In every shadow.  In the da shadows of the trees and the darker waters of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Josh continues to SCREAM, we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven and Randy sit by the counter, Vicki stands beside and we can see Ward back in the kitchen, cooking up some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vicki) What do you mean you've never made a prank call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean never as in really never, or never as in it was just so stupid you don't want to tell us about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean really never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that.  A famous man once said -- there is no worse regret then a temptation resisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Steven, that's...that's really lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, how can you go through life without never having made a prank call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, when Steven was a kid, he was like, having strippers delivered to church Bingos and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disgusting?  Bingo night was sold out for six months after that!  They raised enough money to build a day care center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a community service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.  The church even sent me an autographed picture of God. (yelling to the back) Ward!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting from back) Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever make a prank call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called an adoption agency once when I was like nine or something and I told them I wanted to trade my mom in for a box of Lincoln Logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a wet sponge comes flying in from offscreen and hits Ward in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut the fuck up and cook those burgers?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wanted those fuckin' Logs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he gets up and walks over to the pay phone in the dine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing Vicki what she missed out on by being such a dull kid.  Now, the first thing you need in making a prank call is, of course, a phone. (holds up the phone) This one, for instance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven, c'mon, we're not thirteen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next, you dial a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Steven, I don't want you to do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receiver to see Steven click it off out of view of th others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and it's now ringing...ringing... and -- Hello? Anthony's Pizzeria? Yeah, this is officer Randy Parker over at the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, would you stop, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Anthony?...Yeah, well, I just have one question for you, Anthony -- did you fuck my dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well somebody fucked her and if I find out it was you, I'm gonna come over there and shoot you in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm now begging you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, since I got you on the phone -- ask the guys there if they wanna chip in for a hooker.  I'll send her right over.  Her name is Vicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a waitress at Joey B's but she needs some extra cash.  Ward's the pimp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm literally going to kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten dollars! Hell, I can't do that to you -- you can have her for a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pizza?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Randy walks up to Steven and quickly handcuffs to the metal phone cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) Randy, what the fuck?  Take these off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wards sets two paper bags down on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Randy) Food's ready.  Tell the guys at the station the pimp says hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking food) Sure thing.  See ya', Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, you dipshit!  Take these off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I'm working now.  You see, I have a job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Steven glances at the clock -- 11:10.  He was suppose meet Diana ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With startling speed, Steven pops off the cuff on his wri hangs up, then turns to Randy waving his free wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna know how I did that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Steven smiles) Gotta go.  See you guys later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs past Randy to the door of the diner, then stops a turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, if you'd been paying attention you'd have noticed I held the receiver down when I dialed -- cop like you should be more observant than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he rushes out of the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives me so fucking crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, the phone RINGS.  A key turns in the doo Diana enters.  She finds the light switch as the phone RI again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come on and she dashes across the room to answ the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming!  Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the phone) June the 19th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana thinks a second trying to place the caller...then suddenly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Diana, a shadowy figure appears in the doorway.  W see him as he moves forward, but Diana doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in his car, talking on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when my vacation starts.  If we get married then, we'll have two weeks in Hawaii. (a beat) I love you, Diana.  I'm sorry I've waited this long.  Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana is as happy as she's ever been.  The man (who we no recognize as Josh) is still approaching from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, Ed, I love you too, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now directly behind Diana, Josh snakes a hand out, snatch the receiver from her then slams it back into its cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diana only ha time for a STARTLED GASP as Josh grabs her. takes her head in a firm embrace and draws her face close his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh!  What are you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His lips draw closer and closer to hers.  His eyes are co empty places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her head to the side, away from Josh.  Her eyes open in a terror born of absolute disbelief and a certain knowledge that, except for the pain, she is already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the mirror over the mantle.  In the reflection she see not Josh, but Jason Voorhees, mask in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...Oh Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he reaches out to Diana, turns her head back to his an opens his mouth -- it's dank and vile and there's somethi in there, something that writhes horribly, the same oozin color as Jason's dark heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the thing squirms out from between his teeth and towar Diana's lips, she manages to screams last:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, determined, she reaches down and opens the draw of the phone table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is a service revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone begins to RING AGAIN as Diana grabs the gun and sticks it against Josh's temple as the black thing in his mouth begins to pry her lips apart, trying to worm inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOT RINGS LOUD in the room.  Josh/Jason staggers bac falls to his knees. He's been shot in the back of the hea close range -- it's a wound that would kill anyone human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone CONTINUES TO RING, until it is knocked off it's cradle by Diana as she turns and runs to the patio door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fiddles with it, trying to open it, then glances back make sure Josh/Jason isn't coming for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh/Jason isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit.  She back against a wall, looking around -- whe is he?  She turns.  He's not there.  She spots the phone moves towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, from the darkness of the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Josh/Jason leaps out at her, grabs her and flings her to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The injured, but very obviously alive Josh/Jason holds Diana's head firmly against the carpet.  He lowers his mo towards hers and, once again, that black thing in his mou squirms through his lips.  The phone keeps RINGING and RINGING... Suddenly, the room is bathed in light as a car pulls up outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven enters.  He sees blood and, hearing Diana SCREAM, rushes into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and leaps on Josh, his momentum knocking the man off Dian before Josh can force the horrible, squirming thing from mouth into hers -- but the advantage is just momentary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh/Jason turns to Steven and grabs him by his shirt, picking him up off the ground with what is clearly superh strength and throws him against the nearest wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven hits the wall with a sharp, nearly back-breaking impact.  He lies for a moment, stunned, near unconsciousn then he regains his bearings just in time to see Josh/Jas taking a knife sharpening pole from the knife rack next t him in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Josh/Jason turns and flings the instrument through t air at Steven just as Diana runs up to see if Steven's ok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pole pierces Diana through the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at Steven with a stunned expression and then sinks down to the floor revealing Josh/Jason behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a fury in him now that is terrible to behold.  A unearthly SCREAM of frustration and rage tears from his throat.  His hands reach out, ready to tear into Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven manages to duck, roll and come up beside the firep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh/Jason turns and charges at Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven grabs a fireplace poker and rams it with all of hi strength through Josh/Jason's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does this, he is positioned so that he can't help b see the reflection in the mirror.  He sees Jason Voorhees struggling furiously... trying to pull the poker out of h chest.  In trying to do that, Josh/Jason is thrown backwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crashes through a window and falls outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven rushes back to Diana.  He bends, taking her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) You saw him?  You know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You have to...save...Jessica... Save Jessica and save the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the pain is too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Steven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm scared.  I'm very scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Steven can do is hold her.  Her eyes close.  She dies

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God Almighty, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing there, staring, in shock.  He pulls his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he does this, Steven sets Diana down and runs towards window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Josh.  He fell outside.  He --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing there but darkness.  Josh/Jason is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he turns back to SHERIFF. The man kneels by Diana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my dear God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really to himself) He was dead.  He had to be dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF looks up at Steven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stands covered in blood.  Suddenly, he realizes w this must look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... you can't think I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But SHERIFF's eyes grow cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is in this dismal interrogation room.  He's tired, frightened, angry.  We don't know how long he's been here but it's clearly been a long time.  SHERIFF and Steven's friend, Randy, are in the room with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times do you want to hear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I hear the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've told you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth?  That Josh, a man I've trusted with my own life on more than one occasion -- let me see if I've got the order right here -- tried to rape Diana...got the back of his head blown off...took a poker through the gut...fell through a plate glass window and then magically disappeared into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what it sounds like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't kill her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why were you at her house?!  She didn't want anything to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She asked me to come over.  She said she had something to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Jessica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie.  Diana would never talk to you about Jessica.  Not after what you did to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know I treated her bad --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Bad?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF suddenly hauls off, WHACKS STEVEN ACROSS THE FACE then grabs him by the collar and pulls him close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You call what you did bad?!  You knocked her up and then left her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- she left me!  After her miscarriage, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Miscarriage?!  Who the fuck told you Jessica had a miscarriage?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHERIFF looks at Steven with an almost astonished pity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...you are one sorry son-of-a- bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little frantic) She did have a miscarriage, didn't she?  Didn't she?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you stupid, sorry son-of-a- bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defeated, eyes filled with loss and anger, SHERIFF turns walks away.  Then, just before he exits, he turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If I wasn't the Sheriff here, if I thought I could get away with it... I would kill you right now.  That's no exaggeration. (to Randy) I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven watches him go, then turns to Randy who can't quit bring himself to meet Steven's steady gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy has to think about this.  Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe that you murdered Diana.  I don't know what really happened, but I know you couldn't have done it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven nods -- that's going to have to be enough for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You just sit tight -- I'm gonna take care of this.  I'll straighten everything out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven SIGHS, then closes his eyes and rubs them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Randy... (looks up at Randy) ...what is Jessica gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning light filters through the windows.  The doo opens and JESSICA KIMBLE enters.  She's in her early twen a strikingly beautiful image of her mother.  There is a startled GASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young waitress who worked with Diana at the diner.  S trying to clean the bloodstains off the floor and the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica, I'm so sorry.  I...I wanted to have this cleaned up before you got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all right.  I was just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica fights it, trying not to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki gets up, wiping her hands on her overalls, and walk over to her friend and hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh, God, Vick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hold each other.  Suddenly, we hear a BABY CRYING. Startled, Vicki looks over Jessica's shoulder and sees a carriage, standing just outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki moves to the carriage and picks up the baby, who immediately STOPS CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Stephanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica nods.  A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has Steven's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles from the baby to Jessica, looking for confirma Jessica gives a little, reluctant nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to, I was going to tell everyone.  I just...didn't expect to be back here so soon. (a beat) Is Steven around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vicki nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Does he know about what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (a beat) Sit down a second.  There's something I need to tell you about Steven...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven is sitting alone, waiting to discover his fate. Suddenly the door opens and Randy walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I have to bring you to a cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know, I'm sorry but the Sheriff is just berserk right now. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy leads Steven from the interrogation room towards th jail cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully we won't have to hold you more than a day.  I'm gonna bust my ass to prove you innocent but you gotta be cool or Landis will really kil you, okay?  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steven has not been paying attention -- he's staring at something on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jessica enters through the front door with Vicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his eyes we see that, in spite of whatever might have happened in the past, he really loves this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jessica...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she suddenly turns and lifts something up into view -- baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As his eyes widen, realizing what this means, what it was that Diana was going to tell him, what Landis meant by hi talk about a "miscarriage".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his daughter he's looking at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly another man comes through the police station doo and places his hands protectively on Jessica's shoulders. She turns away from Steven and looks at this new arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Robert Campbell, the host of "American Casefile". He and Steven each eye each other...instant enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Randy jerks Steven away towards the cell block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Randy SLAMS THE CELL DOOR in front of him, locking him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back later.  You just be cool, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do anything stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I gonna do -- I'm locked up in a friggin' cell?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get your outta this.  Just hang tight.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff is working at his desk when there's a KNOCK A THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Jessica (carrying her baby), Vicki and Robert enter.  The Sheriff immediately jumps up and hugs Jessica tightly.  He says nothing -- there's nothing to s Finally, when they break:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed...I'd like you to meet my boyfriend, Robert Campbell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Landis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen your show.  I like it about as much as I like anything on the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're not down here on business.  I wouldn't take kindly to seeing Diana's face on one of your programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an arm around Jessica) No, sir.  I'm just here for Jess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landis nods, apparently satisfied.  He looks at Jessica's baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cute little fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without missing a beat) And as pretty as her mamma...and her mamma before that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad beat of silence.  Suddenly, the INTERCOM BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over intercom) Sheriff, we, uh, we have a problem with Diana Kimble's body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff immediately snatches up the phone so he can t privately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause as the Sheriff listens and we can tell f his face that whatever the problem is...it's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him here.  I wanna talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff smiles disarmingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the funeral home just has a couple questions.  Wait here, I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff storms down this hallway in a fury.  At the o end we see Creighton Duke, in cuffs, walking towards him OFFICER DILL slightly behind, trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the Sheriff and Duke get nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is she, Duke?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'd like to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found him in the morgue.  The body was missing and he was standing over the open cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Duke) What the hell were you doing there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) Trying to steal the body, obviously... but you fucked up and let someone get to it before I could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff can barely contain himself upon hearing this. tries to calm down, but it's an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you want her body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a good reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Information like that is very expensive and you don't have the balls to pay the price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheriff turns to Officer Dill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock this asshole up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can lock me up in this piss-ass prison?  Hell, this place is motel fuckin' six to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheriff) You better find that body right away you incompetant dickhead because if it's where I think it is...you're gonna be in world of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Officer Dill) Lock him the fuck up and after you do, I want you to find that body -- do you understand me!  I don't care what you have to do, I don't care where you have to go, FIND IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Landis enters with a pleasant smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, nothing.  It's taken care of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's okay, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) Yes, everything's okay.
